title: Vice - Specialized Stumpjumper Evo Elite Alloy

images.alt: Gap jump feature built for the Gravy Train trail
Performing a wheelie on Vice
Jumping on Vice at the trails
Speed tucking on Vice
Vice mountain bike at Pacifica trails
Transporting flowers on Vice in San Francisco
Side on photo of Vice showing all components
Vice at Benders bar in San Francisco

contentBlocks.content: Vice is my favorite bike. I had been looking for a new full suspension bike for a while and wasn't feeling ready to commit until I test rode this very bike at a local shop. I bought it that day. I was taken by how stable and in-the-bike I felt. And that control and confidence has translated to my riding, thankfully. My first rides on this bike saw me clearing bigger gaps and riding steeper nastier descents than I otherwise would have tried.

content: Frame: Specialized Stumpjumper Evo Elite Alloy S5
Suspension: Fox Factory 36 Grip2 160mm - Fox Float X2 Factory
Fork Settings: 115 psi, LSR 4 clicks, HSR 3 clicks, LSC 10 clicks, HSC 5 clicks
Shock Settings: 230 psi, Rebound 4 clicks, Compression 6 clicks
Tire Pressures: 25 psi front, 27 psi rear (tubeless)

contentBlocks.content: Some favorite memories with this bike definitely include riding it around on the streets of San Francisco, exploring, carrying flowers, or between bars with new friends. Let's go for a ride!

title: Pickles and Cream - All-City Cosmic Stallion
description: My gravel and adventure bike, perfect for long days in the saddle.

images.alt: Pickles and Cream in a glamour shot
Pickles and Cream on the Washington State Ferry
Bikepacking setup on Pickles and Cream
Bikepacking cockpit setup on Pickles and Cream
Night shot of Pickles and Cream on Bainbridge Island
Pickles and Cream ready for the night with a bikepacking tent
Bottom up view of Gen on Pickles and Cream!
Riding Pickles and Cream on the Iron Horse Trail

contentBlocks.content: I bought this lovely bike from an air traffic controller. I bought it for it's hydraulic brakes, which I knew I needed for wheelies and other maneuvers on the streets of seattle. This bike has been great for singletrack, bikepacking, group rides, getting croceries, trips to the hospital... Oh! And it's called Pickles 'N' Cream for it's lovely green and white paint.
This bike was excellent on a 2 day, 3 ferry winter trip. Riding two 50 mile days in a row in 40 degrees was a really gorgeous time.

title: Divine Hammer - Commencal Meta HT AM
description: My hardtail trail bike, built for aggressive riding and simplicity.

images.alt: Divine Hammer in Queen Anne
Divine Hammer at Raging River
Dropping off of the DIY spot in the Milwaukee Woods
Divine Hammer on the ice of Lake Michigan

contentBlocks.content: When I lived in Milwaukee and rode all through the winter, a 27.5x2.8 tire, single speed hardtail sounded fun, simple, and bulletproof. I'm glad I got to try that experiment, and I'm glad I wasn't disappointed by my second bike from Commencal. This bike cleaned up on all of my favorites in Wisconsin, and help up very very well on black diamond tech trails in the PNW, though not without considerable hand fatigue. I still have this bike because it's too fun to let go.

content: Frame: Commencal Meta HT AM Essential XL
Tires: Maxxis High Roller II 2.8, Maxxis Rekon + 2.8
Tire Pressures: 18 psi front, 20 psi rear (tubeless)

contentBlocks.content: This Bike flew along with me to New Zealand, where it saw me through many days of riding including lift access in Christchurch, and many of the most beautiful rides of my life. It's named for a song by The Breeders!

content.alt: Detail shot of the surly singleator single speed conversion
content.caption: Single speed conversion from Surly

contentBlocks.content: I don't at all regret taking the time to set this up single speed for a while. It was super super fun and unique, and this is still the only bike I've done a barspin on!

content.alt: OEM Style decals with custom color to match my art on the stem top cap
content.caption: OEM Style decals with custom color to match my art on the stem top cap

contentBlocks.content: I had these decals custom printed to match my top cap, which is printed with some of my algorithmic art from 2020.

content.alt: Stem topcap with algorithmic art printed on
content.caption: Custom stem topcap featuring algorithimic art

title: Bike Projects
description: Building ramps, trails, and working on bikes is a passion of mine. I love creating spaces and tools that bring the cycling community together.

images.alt: Mountain bike skinny drop built on a tree branch
Drop platform and large landing at the farm
Custom built high jump bar for bikes
Wooden bike workstand holding Hot Mess Express
Fatbike cart CAD design ready for build
Fatbike cart with two fatbikes
Folding ramp constructed from online build plans
Mountain bike skinny installed on the farm

contentBlocks.content: I love to design, I love to build. The projects shown here are all my own designs with the exception of a folding ramp built from online instructions.
I also do all of my own mechanic work on my bikes, excepting damper service on my suspension. I'm hoping to join in for more volunteer trail building with local organizations in the PNW.

title: Juno - Minivan Stealth Car Camper
description: A micro-budget stealth minivan camper conversion that took me on an amazing month-long adventure through California.

images.alt: Cozy lighting setup in Juno
Testing the bed platform in Juno
Completed Juno camper conversion
Brushing teeth stealthily in Juno
Bed platform and window covers in Juno
Juno camper conversion in progress
Enjoying a burrito in the campervan

contentBlocks.content: Juno is my micro-budget stealth minivan camper conversion. Years of fantasizing about campervan trips coincided with my owning a nearly 20 year old minivan which resulted in this build.

content.alt: CAD model of the wooden bed platform designed to fit in my minivan
content.caption: I only decided to make a CAD model after a wasted evening building the structure from sketches on cardboard boxes

contentBlocks.title: Bed Platform CAD Model from Below

content.alt: CAD model of the wooden bed platform designed to fit in my minivan, shown from below to detail support structure
content.caption: The supports for the platform shown from below - The supports offered peace of mind about stability while allowing maximum space for storage beneath

content.alt: The wooden bed platform pictured installed next to a rear seat from the vehicle
content.caption: As designed, the bed platform takes up one half of the rear of the vehicle, leaving the other half clear for seats or cargo

content.alt: A view of a beach on the pacific ocean, from atop a cliff.
content.caption: The setup survived a month long trip from Seattle to San Diego and Back, with plenty of detours and about 4000 miles traveled

images.alt: Skating at Sea Skate park
Skating downtown
Bike and skateboard at Colonnade pump track
Custon CNC cut skateboard rack in the apartment

contentBlocks.content: I'm not exceptionally capable on a skateboard, but I deeply love the completeness of learning a new trick, and the feeling of the board rumbling, snapping, and landing under my feet. I also deeply appreciate the artistry and the community of skateboarding, and am proud to participate in both.

title: Cooking and Baking
description: Pictures of food I'm proud to have made!

images.alt: A variety of homemade ice cream sandwiches
Blueberry smoothie
Matcha latte and biscotti at desk
Dramatic angle of drinks
Smoothie and two matcha lattes
Blueberry lavender matcha latte
A jar of homemade vegan kimchi!

contentBlocks.content: I don't cook quite as much as I used to, but ask me for a smoothie, a matcha latte, or some mac and cheese and you're not likely to be disappointed.

title: Matcha WebPage
description: A deep dive into the world of matcha tea.

images.alt: Matcha appreciation site thumbnail

contentBlocks.content: When I learned how to make a good matcha latte at home things really changed for me. Since then I've experimented a lot and I'm proud to show off some of that story. This site also served as a great project to brush up on web dev and self hosting. Check it out!

title: Cozy Woodsy Apartment
description: My cozy apartment setup with a woodsy, natural aesthetic.

images.alt: Forest canopy bed design
Plush hammock in the apartment

contentBlocks.content: When I moved into a space all my own for the first time I decided that making it restful and cozy was a top priority. Having fallen in love with the lush deep greens of the PNW right away, I knew bringing them into my home would bring the restful energy I was after. The canopy was also something I couldn't stop thinking about, and it adds a feeling of shelter that I really appreciate.
